perturbation.original_text: This Agreement shall be governed and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of Delaware, without reference to the conflicts of laws principles thereunder.
perturbation.changed_text: This Agreement shall be governed and construed in accordance with the laws of England, without reference to the conflicts of laws principles thereunder.
perturbation.explanation: Changing the governing law to England omits the consumer protections afforded under Delaware law, potentially disadvantaging Igene Biotechnology, Inc., a Maryland corporation. Delaware law often provides stronger protections for corporate entities, which could be considered a consumer right in this context. Switching to English law may remove some of these protections.

perturbation.original_text:
Each Party (the "Recipient Party") agrees to hold in confidence and not to disclose either directly or indirectly to any third party any technical, financial, commercial or other information (the "Information") as may be revealed or disclosed orally, in writing or otherwise to it by the other Party or by the Joint Venture (the "Disclosing Party") and shall refrain from using any such Information for any purpose whatsoever other than for the purpose(s) for which the Information was disclosed or unless previously approved in writing by the Disclosing Party; provided, however, that these obligations shall not apply to Information:

(i) which at the time of disclosure to the Recipient Party was in the public domain,

(ii) which after disclosure to the Recipient Party becomes part of the public domain through no fault of said Party,

(iii) which at the time of disclosure to the Recipient Party was in its possession or was independently developed by the Recipient Party (and the Recipient Party can demonstrate such by written documents dated before the time of disclosure),

(iv) which disclosure is obtained by the Recipient Party from a third party which has not, either directly or indirectly, received the Information from the Disclosing Party; or

(v) which disclosure is required otherwise by law, unless compelled to disclose such documents or information by judicial or administrative process.
perturbation.changed_text:
Each Party (the "Recipient Party") agrees to hold in confidence and not to disclose either directly or indirectly to any third party any technical, financial, commercial or other information (the "Information") as may be revealed or disclosed orally, in writing or otherwise to it by the other Party or by the Joint Venture (the "Disclosing Party") and shall refrain from using any such Information for any purpose whatsoever other than for the purpose(s) for which the Information was disclosed or unless previously approved in writing by the Disclosing Party; provided, however, that these obligations shall not apply to Information:

(i) which at the time of disclosure to the Recipient Party was in the public domain,

(ii) which after disclosure to the Recipient Party becomes part of the public domain through no fault of said Party,

(iii) which at the time of disclosure to the Recipient Party was in its possession or was independently developed by the Recipient Party (and the Recipient Party can demonstrate such by written documents dated before the time of disclosure),

(iv) which disclosure is obtained by the Recipient Party from a third party which has not, either directly or indirectly, received the Information from the Disclosing Party; or

(v) which disclosure is required otherwise by law.
perturbation.explanation: Removing 'unless compelled to disclose such documents or information by judicial or administrative process' from the confidentiality clause forces a party to breach the confidentiality agreement even if legally required to disclose information, which is against the law, as the disclosing parties are obligated to follow the laws, which includes judicial orders to provide these documents, if there is a court order.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Varies based on jurisdiction, but examples include laws relating to subpoena compliance, mandatory reporting, and court orders.

perturbation.original_text: Each Party shall prepare its tax reports and returns in a manner not inconsistent with the tax reports and returns of the Operating Company, except in the case of manifest error.
perturbation.changed_text: Each Party shall prepare its tax reports and returns as they see fit.
perturbation.explanation: The original text ensures consistency and transparency. By removing the requirement for tax reports to be consistent with the Operating Company's reports, each party can report taxes as they see fit, which can be to their advantage but may not accurately reflect tax obligations, in violation of IRS regulations (if in the US).
